values: I'm sorry, Livejournal. You seem to have gone the way of Opendiary, Faceparty, Friendster and MySpace (except for music). Your music, however, is in the Comms. LJ comms are still rocking. I'm in France now. Here is my Other Blog: Tea & Sarcam It's less whiny. I promise.

It's probably not the worst song ever written, but I'd have to be offered something mighty tempting like my entire student loans paid off in full to have to listen to James Blunt's "You're Beautiful" for an hour, let alone 24 of them. His voice grates on me so so much and the song is dreary.

Sharpie self-portrait II
Originally uploaded by nicasaurusrex
Dear LJ,

Last night I drew a couple of self-portraits. This is my favourite.

Hello, this is Nic/Nicola/Nicsi/Spookie I have changed my name from _sleepflower to . I've only changed the name - not gotten a new journal, I don't want to purge my past, as much of it is still my present. The name, in context of its origin, is pretty downbeat, but I like it. It also has Manics connotations, and I like that :) Points if you can tell me where I got my name from. More points if you can tell me where the MANICS got it from... (note: I got it from the original) I'd like to take the opportunity to RE-FriendsOnly this journal. If you're not on my friends list, then all you'll wind up seeing are boring surveys, so...

The Everything Test

There are many different types of tests on the internet today. Personality tests, purity tests, stereotype tests, political tests. But now, there is one test to rule them all.

Traditionally, online tests would ask certain questions about your musical tastes or clothing for a stereotype, your experiences for a purity test, or deep questions for a personality test.We're turning that upside down - all the questions affect all the results, and we've got some innovative results too! Enjoy :-)

Personality
You are more emotional than logical, more concerned about others than concerned about self, more atheist than religious, more dependent than loner, more lazy than workaholic, more traditional than rebel, more artistic mind than engineering mind, more idealist than cynical, more leader than follower, and more introverted than extroverted.

As for specific personality traits, you are intellectual (93%), adventurous (80%), artistic (69%), musical (59%).

If your life was a movie, it would be rated R.
By the way, your hottness rank is 55%, hotter than 78% of other test takers.

Hmmm... I detest the EMO accusation, and I think I'm more musical than that, but everything else is pretty accurate. Hooray!

I'm currently reading three books: Possession (by A.S. Byatt, the college Lit text), Candy (by Luke Davies, about heroin/love), and The Turn Of The Screw (a Victorian thriller by Henry James). My to-read pile reaches my knee.

Hehe, I'm IMming Frank the Goat..... watching the Forever Delayed DVD. I'd forgotten how totally mindblowing The Masses Against The Classes is. Very. This DVD's lasted numerous replays over almost 4 years. Well done that disc!

What's Your Reputation at Hogwarts? (26 different characters)

Crazy Outspoken Psycho (Who's Original In Every Way)House: HufflepuffBest Friend(s): Blaise, Fred, George, and yourself.GryffindorsHarry: Thinks you hate him ever since you called him a "creep". (And is still a little upset that you never gave Cedric the chance to ask you to the Yule Ball so he could go with Cho).Ron: Likes that you don't bow down to Harry and that you wear whatever you want without being so self-consious.Hermione: Is envious of your hair. She loves how you color it, keep it shiny and tamed, and how you do it. Her favorite of your hair styles was your "Hot Pink Streaks" style.Oliver Wood: Has dreams about meeting you in person and falling head over heels for you immediately.Fred and George Weasley: Are your best friends and sidekicks. You assist them in every way possible, and vice versa.Seamus Finnigan: Likes that you wear different colored clothes and don't bother to always match but somehow manage to look great.Neville Longbottom: Thinks you're a little loopy but is still kind to you.Dean Thomas: Always compares his girlfriends to you.Ginny Weasley: Helped you add blue dye to your hair one day because she wanted to find out if you were actually that cool in real life.Parvati Patil: Copies your style profusely and relentlessly.Padma Patil: Secretly hates you ever since you mistook her for her sister and called her a "brainless fashion robot".HufflepuffsCedric Diggory: Was going to ask you to the Yule Ball but was cut short when George and Fred ran up to with a new idea for their shop and you excused yourself excitedly.RavenclawsCho Chang: Is upset that Cedric only asked her to the Yule Ball as a last resort, but still accepts the fact that you're much better looking than she could ever hope to be.SlytherinsDraco Malfoy: Wants to be able to express himself like you. He wishes he didn't have to care what other people of him and could just say "I don't give a fuck," with as much ease as you do.Crabbe: Is attracted to your bright hair and clothes.Goyle: Likes your really long eye lashes.Pansy Parkinson: Wishes she had beauty like yours.Marcus Flint: Likes your taste in music (electronic, indie, alternative) and almost mustered up enough courage to ask you to a concert.Blaise Zabini: Is one of your other closest friends because you got him to open up. He confessed everything to you and even cried a little on your shoulder, and you two are the best of friends.TeachersDumbledore: Has no doubt that you'll take your creativity to all new levels as you mature. (as in get older, not more... motherly).Professor McGonagall: Is proud, but watchful, of your ambition.Professor Flitwick: Likes you, but doesn't know you too well.Professor Trelawney: Asks you for your opinion on everything she does.Professor Snape: Loves how you brighten the room, but hates how you attract the attention.Filch: Envies you for having so much fun at school.

Did I really just hear Nikki say that she has her heating on 24hours a day at 30 degrees? 

Fucking hell, i know she used to be anorexic, hence no insulation on her, but that's just taking it a bit too far. Most i can handle in the winter is about 22-24 degrees. PUT A FUCKING JUMPER ON BEFORE BRITISH GAS SEND A SNIPER OUT ON YOU!

Yesterday, a guy I used to know quite well posted a picture on the Kerrang.com messageboards. This was a photograph taken of a few of us at Ozzfest 2002. I cried when I saw it. The guy on the right is my friend Christopher Pyke. I've not seen him in two and a half years. When I last spoke to him, it was in the summer of 03 just before I left my dad's. He was living in a squat with some really dodgy characters, and taking a lot of substances. He wasn't taking care of himself, so ended up in hospital a lot due to his diabetes. Then the calls stopped, and I couldn't get through on his phone. My good friend who comes from the same town, said he and his dad had moved away; he was just going to die if he stayed in that scene. Since he moved, no one has heard from him in our group of friends, and I don't know any of the druggies he was squatting with. His phone number is still inactive, and his email returns things that I send. I'm so scared that he went back to the scene, and died there. I'm so scared that someone who cared about me, and who I cared deeply for has lost himself. I just need to know that he's ok.
He's shy. And blackandwhite with big whiskers and eyebrows like Goblin had. and he MIAOWS. He's the hiding one, btw. The other one is my dad. He doesn't miaow much. :)

Ten Top Trivia Tips about Spookie!

  1. Spookieocracy is government by Spookie.
  2. A lump of Spookie the size of a matchbox can be flattened into a sheet the size of a tennis court!
  3. California is the biggest exporter of Spookie in the world.
  4. Spookie is the sacred animal of Thailand.
  5. 68 percent of all UFO sightings are by Spookie!
  6. Humans share over 98 percent of their DNA with Spookie.
  7. If you keep a goldfish in a dark room, it will eventually turn into Spookie.
  8. You share your birthday with Spookie.
  9. There are more than two hundred different kinds of Spookie.
  10. The difference between Spookie and a village is that Spookie does not have a church.
I am interested in - do tell me about

1: Grab the book nearest to you, turn to page 18, find line 4. Write down what it says:
"Ut coniecturam faciam - necesse est tibi bibere..."

2: Stretch your left arm out as far as you can. What are you touching?
Nothing. Nearly the wall.

3: What is the last thing you watched on TV?
Celebrity Big Brother.

4. What time is it WITHOUT LOOKING?
6.20 am.

5: Now look at the clock, what is the actual time?:
0622! WIN!

6: With the exception of the computer, what can you hear?:
The fridge, and birds. 

7: When did you last step outside? what were you doing?:
I went to put money on my gas meter last night. About 8pm.

8: Before you came to this website, what did you look at?:
I was watching Spaced. 

9: What are you wearing?:
PJ bottoms, odd socks, bra, Zim shirt, zip up hoodie.

10: Did you dream last night?:
Yes. I dreamt I stabbed someone with a stonefish.

11: When did you last laugh?
Watching Withnail&I earlier on.

12: What is on the walls of the room you are in?:
10 posters, 6 framed pieces, a calendar, some photographs, a clock, a plastic aquarium, and some graffiti. It's my living room.

13: Seen anything weird lately?:
Nothing too exceptional. Arnie's lip looks odd.

14: What do you think of this quiz?:
Bit short, by the looks of things.

15: What is the last film you saw?:
Withnail&I. And we still didn't finish it!

16: If you became a multi-millionaire overnight, what would you buy first?:
A grand piano. Steinway, please.

17: Tell me something about you that I don't know:
I stutter. 

18: If you could change one thing about the world, regardless of guilt or politics, what would you change?
Probably the US presence in Iraq. Save them the embarrassment of eventually pulling their troops out.

19: Do you like to dance?:
Oh hell yeah.

20: Imagine your first child is a girl, what do you call her?:
Imogen.

21: Imagine your first child is a boy, what do you call him?:
Elliott.

22: Would you ever consider living abroad?:
Been there, done that. And yes, I would.

I called my mum tonight, to chat about exam stress and stuff. 
The phone beeped, and a voice I didn't recognise answered. 
Jaimie. My stepbrother. 
We had a brief "hello, how are you"-like conversation. 

I've not seen him since I was 10. It feels sort of weird, knowing that he's in my place over there. I can't picture the house with any outside forces in it. It's my mother's castle. Her impenetrable, pristine fortress.

I really hope I can afford a plane ticket this Spring. This will be interesting to see; the change in family dynamic. 
I can't believe how much of an outsider I feel to this sometimes.
